update.description:
When a link's kinematic property is set to true, `dBodySetKinematic` is called on that link and its mass becomes infinite. The problem is that, later on, its mass is set to something else, even when inertial properties are not specified. This is due to the fact that, by default, a link is given a mass of 1.0.

I see two ways to fix this issue:

- The SDF format could be modified to allow a link not to have a mass.

- If a link is kinematic, its mass must not be set.

This pull request implements the second idea.
update.title: Do not update the center of mass if object is kinematic

content.raw: the change looks good to me, pulled into a local branch and started a [jenkins job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/636/)

When a link's kinematic property is set to true, `dBodySetKinematic` is called on that link and its mass becomes infinite. The problem is that, later on, its mass is set to something else, even when inertial properties are not specified. This is due to the fact that, by default, a link is given a mass of 1.0.

I see two ways to fix this issue:

- If a link is kinematic, its mass must not be set.

This pull request implements the second idea.
